metadata.subject: Beaulieu, Jean-François Bremont
Agasse, Henri, 1752-1813
Presumption of innocence
Equality before the law
metadata.title: Discours de M. Baron de S.-Giron, représentant à la commune, juge de paix du district Saint-Honoré, en présentant M. Beaulieu.
metadata.creator: Tallien, Jean-Lambert, 1767-2630
Baron de Saint-Girons, Charles, b. 1735
Beaulieu, Jean-François Bremont
Mulot, François-Valentin, 1749-1804
Lottin, Augustin-Martin, 1726-1793, publisher
Lottin de Saint Germain, Jean-Roch, b. 1754, publisher
metadata.publisher: [Paris] : De l'imprimerie de Lottin l'aîné, & Lottin de S.-Germain, imprimeurs-libraires ordinaires de la ville, rue S.-André-des-Arcs, (no 27)
metadata.citation: Martin & Walter. Révolution française, I, 1758; I, 2204; III, 25504
metadata.description: Adresses in praise of Jean-François Bremont Beaulieu, who offered to give his commission to Henri Agasse, brother of two convicted forgers, and lauding this example of the new republic's ideals of liberty and justice
metadata.notes: No copyright found. No table of contents found. Title on cover. Damaged, stained pages and cover.
